intro: Phthirusa phaeoclados, commonly known as the black-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, leathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or arctic regions. It has a compact growth form and is adapted to cold, dry environments. Phthirusa phaeoclados is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in rock gardens or alpine plantings.
